comment: Smart Data models - valueconditional schema derived from the open connectivity foundation repository https://github.com/openconnectivityfoundation/IoTDataModels adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OCF/master/valueconditional/schema.json
description: This Resource specifies conditions that can be applied to an observed value in any Resource.These conditions are applied by the OCF Server exposing the Resource to any generated notifications because of subscriptions to the Resource.A unicast RETRIEVE to the Resource will receive the most recent value; which may not be the most recent notified value.An OCF Server exposes this Resource in association with the Resource conveying the observed value.This is done by means of a new Resource instance with an RT of

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: maxnotifyperiod
contents.comment: The maximum elapsed time in ms before a notification must be sent

contents.name: minnotifyperiod
contents.comment: The minimum elapsed time in ms before a notification is sent

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object

contents.name: threshold
contents.comment: The amount by which the measured value must change before a notification is sent

contents.name: if
contents.comment: The OCF Interface set supported by this Resource

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
